definition: Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: What advantage melanism brings in these circumstances is obscure.
sentences.chinese: 在這些環境中表皮黑化到底有什麼優勢似乎模糊不清。

sentences.english: The original impact gets lost, or diffused.
sentences.chinese: 最初的印像消失了，或者變得模糊不清。

sentences.english: But there are some inadequacies such as fuzziness existing in most of the model analyses.
sentences.chinese: 然而所能見到的建模分析，多存在模糊不清等不足。

sentences.english: The light vanished, and all became indistinct once more.
sentences.chinese: 光線消失了，一切又變得模糊不清。

sentences.english: The cold fog pooling around us, the dim bright light on our faces.
sentences.chinese: 冷氣圍繞着我們，模糊不清的燈光照在我們臉上。

sentences.english: Myopia (nearsightedness) is an abnormal elongation of the eye, causing distant objects to appear blurred.
sentences.chinese: 近視是視力不正常的伸長，使遠距離的物體模糊不清。

sentences.english: Street lights and car headlights are fuzzy.
sentences.chinese: 街燈和汽車大燈都模糊不清。

sentences.english: The left kidney and psoas shadows may be indistinct .
sentences.chinese: 左腎和腰肌陰影可模糊不清。

sentences.english: The color became faint as the sun set.
sentences.chinese: 太陽下山後，顏色變得模糊不清。

sentences.english: Your mind is like this water, when it agitated, it becomes difficulit to see.
sentences.chinese: 你的心好似這潭湖水，如果波瀾起伏，就會模糊不清。

sentences.english: The wise man distrusts what isn't clear.
sentences.chinese: 明智的人不會信任模糊不清的事物。

sentences.english: But most titles are more ambiguous.
sentences.chinese: 但是大多數的職稱是模糊不清的。

sentences.english: The tombstone inscriptions are blurred by a barrel of toppled red paint.
sentences.chinese: 翻倒的紅油漆已將碑文染得模糊不清。

sentences.english: Teenage mood, like the bubble-like blurred.
sentences.chinese: 十幾歲的心情，猶如泡沫般模糊不清。
蒸汽使我的眼鏡模糊不清。

sentences.english: The steam has misted the windows over.

definition: pitch-black/(fig.) to be completely in the dark
